Pre-Game Insights: The Pakistan vs New Zealand T20 series starts on April 18th, 2024, in Rawalpindi Cricket Stadium.
Pakistan won the previous five-match T20 series against New Zealand 4-1 in April 2023.
This series is seen as ideal preparation for both teams ahead of the T20 World Cup in June 2024.
Shaheen Shah Afridi was replaced as captain due to poor performances.
Babar Azam has returned as captain under the new PCB management led by chairman Mohsin Naqvi.
Muhammad Amir and Imad Wasim have been recalled to the Pakistan squad after long absences.
New Zealand will be without key players like Kane Williamson, Devon Conway, and others due to IPL commitments.
Will Young, Tom Latham, and Tim Southee will also miss the series due to personal commitments.
Michael Bracewell has been appointed as the captain of the New Zealand team for this series.
Others: The schedule for the series is as follows: 1st T20 on April 18, 2024, 2nd T20 on April 20, 2024, 3rd T20 on April 21, 2024, 4th T20 on April 25, 2024, and 5th T20 on April 27, 2024.
